page.title: 13PLAISTOW GENERAL SURVEY
page.content:
{Plaistow is an old Sussex village}with a church, a chapel, a village hall and two pubs, one of which was a coach stop and is 400 years old. There is a village store, post office and garage to serve a population of approximately 500 - 600. Many of the houses are 400 years old. The manor house was the main farm but is now a residence, preserving the old farm buildings. Nestled at the east of the village is a{council estate of 30 houses and 12 {flats.}Plaistow's attraction is the unspoilt quaintness of the old houses and cottages restored to today's living but retaining their{rural and {traditional features.
{Plaistow is surrounded by farms,}7 of which the children surveyed for land use.
